intro: Kleberiella uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower kleberiella, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pale pink. The plant has a compact growth habit with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Kleberiella uniflora is considered a species of conservation concern.
